ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained insight into neuroscience research relevant to ongoing research in the department, as well as a deeper understanding of other students' research. I also enjoyed the BIC Users' meetings that happened sometimes during current works!
Good talks in the seminars organized. Learned new aspects of research in psychology and neuroscience.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Really interesting research presentations, and I enjoyed the seminar format! Weaknesses: Felt a bit disorganized, as no schedule was sent out ahead of time and we sometimes only heard about the meetings days before they occurred.
I think the talks could have been a bit more focused on venturing underlying neural mechanisms of behaviors being studied.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely, some of the speakers were excellent!
